moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4: Here I'm playing black on a bishop game.
moves.2... Nf6 3. d3 d5: Maybe not the best move but I prefer open situations.
moves.4. exd5 Nxd5: Exchanging the pieces, clearing the field.
moves.5. Qf3: Threatening f7, so I can't move my knight + he threats my knight.
moves.5... Be6 6. Nc3 Nxc3: c6 would have probably be better here. Now I will get some problems.
moves.7. Bxe6 fxe6 8. Qxb7: Lost a piece without a compensation + my defense is breaking.
moves.9. bxc3 Bc5: Moving the bishop to castle + threatening the f2 square.
moves.10. Bg5: ! Nice idea. Can't take it and I can't protect it with my knight. I must put my rook or my queen to b8.
moves.12. Bh4 O-O: Now my situation is not that great. He got the advantage.
moves.13. Nf3 Rb2: Threatening c2 to reget my lost pawn.
moves.14. Kd2: ! Now that the queens are exchanged no need to castle.
moves.14... Rf5: Well there's almost nothing to exploit here. Planning to clear the d line.
moves.15. Rhb1: No choice to take it, now it's him who's gonna have the b line.
moves.15... Rxb1 16. Rxb1: Well he really have the advantage right now.
moves.18. Rb8+ Kf7 19. Ng5+: Nice combination but it's going nowhere.
moves.19... Kg6 20. dxe4 Rxg5: He probably not thought about that! But it's far to be finished.
moves.21. Bxg5 Kxg5 22. Rb5: Gained a piece but it gonna be impossible to keep this one. Nice pin btw, I don't know if it was planned already.
moves.22... Nxe4+: Doing my best to save my pieces.
moves.23. Ke1 Kf4 24. f3 Bf2+ 25. Kf1: Well I'm really on a lost position!!
moves.25... Nxc3 26. Rb4+: Well he should have gone to b3 right now.
moves.26... Ke3 27. Rb3 Kd2: No choice to lose my bishop.
moves.28. Kxf2 Nxa2: A knight vs a rook I don't see a way to win this.
moves.29. Ra3 Nc3: Same if I'm clearing this part of the field, he's gonna take all my pawns.
moves.30. Rxa7 Nb5: Threatening the rook + protecting my pawn. But it's impossible anyway to stop the rook to g7.
moves.32... Nd6: ? If he goes to d7, the game is over.
moves.33. Rxg7: Well... there's still a hope. Don't forget it's a blitz game.
moves.33... Nxc4 34. Rxh7 Ne5: Clearing the way for my c pawn.
moves.35. Rh6 c5 36. Rxe6: Well I'm really outnumbered!! But I'm gonna win this!
moves.36... Nd3+ 37. Kg3 c4 38. Rc6: If he take my pawn there's just no way that my knight can take alone all of his pawns. I don't know why I'm not resigning.
moves.38... c3 39. h4 c2: Well he just need to take the pawn.
moves.40. f4: I don't know why he don't keep moving his h pawn. My knight will never be able to reach it anyway.
moves.40... Nb4: It looklike a very desperated move!
moves.41. Rc4 Na2 42. h5 Nc3: !! Now the pawn is protected! The advantage just switched.
moves.43. Rd4+: There's just no way to stop my pawn.
moves.43... Ke3 44. h6 Kxd4: I probably should have promoted my pawn here.
moves.45. h7 c1=Q 46. h8=Q+: Well I didn't thought I was in the same line that his queen!! Anyway I keep the advantage because of my knight.
moves.48. Kg4 Qd1+ 49. Kf5: Now there's just no way to check him again.
moves.49... Qa4: Protecting the knight + ready for the next moves.
moves.50. Qh3+ Kd4 51. Qh8+ Ke3: Staying near my knight, there's not many other thing to do.
moves.52. Qh3+ Kd4 53. Qh8+ Ke3: Thinking about to do a draw. Anyway I was not supposed to win this.
moves.55... Nd6+ 56. Kg4 Qd7+: Checking till I find a way to trap the king.
moves.57. Kg3 Qg7+ 58. Kf2: ? Very bad idea to go there.
moves.60. Kf2 Qe1#: Well it was a nice game.
